intro: Habranthus cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, strap-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
